author: _prototypo
content: <@!364458974906548225> (and maybe <@456226577798135808>) On your recent call with PegaSys' Team X you mentioned that the merry-go-round sync would be maybe 15-20 MBytes in 15seconds for a 24-hour sync. That would mean 1-1.3 MByte/s or roughly 10Mbps. That would  would be difficult for many people to sustain on their networks, especially once one adds in protocol overheads and possibly encryption. Is your answer for those on slow networks to simply use a slower merry-go-round?

author: _prototypo
content: <@!364458974906548225> Also, 15-20MBytes/15 sec == only 84-115 GB/day. Is that enough for a full sync? I understand full state is larger than that...
